agencies.name: Telecommunications Industry Ombudsman
agencies.description: Independent dispute resolution service for small business and residential consumers in Australia who have a complaint about their telephone or internet service.

steps: Contact your service provider first
Wait at least 8 weeks for resolution or receive a deadlock letter
Submit complaint to TIO online, by phone, or post
TIO will investigate and work toward resolution
Binding decision may be issued if needed
process.timeframe: Most complaints resolved within 10 business days
requirements: Must be a small business or residential consumer
Must have attempted resolution with provider first
Complaint must be about a TIO member service

agencies.name: Australian Communications and Media Authority
agencies.description: Regulates broadcasting, internet, radiocommunications and telecommunications in Australia.

steps: Report the issue online or by phone
ACMA will assess if it falls under their jurisdiction
Investigation may be conducted if warranted
Enforcement action taken if breaches found
requirements: Issue must relate to ACMA's regulatory responsibilities
Evidence of the problem should be provided

agencies.name: Australian Financial Complaints Authority
agencies.description: Independent dispute resolution service for consumers and small businesses with complaints about financial services.

steps: Contact your financial service provider first
Wait for their internal dispute resolution process
Submit complaint to AFCA if unresolved after 45 days
AFCA will review and investigate
Binding determination may be issued
requirements: Must be a consumer or small business
Complaint must be about an AFCA member
Internal dispute resolution must be attempted first

agencies.name: Australian Competition and Consumer Commission
agencies.description: Promotes competition and fair trading and regulates national infrastructure for the benefit of all Australians.

steps: Report the issue online via Scamwatch or contact form
Provide detailed information and evidence
ACCC will assess the report
Investigation may be conducted for systemic issues
Enforcement action taken if breaches found
requirements: Issue must involve potential breaches of consumer law
Evidence and documentation should be provided

agencies.name: Energy & Water Ombudsman NSW
agencies.description: Independent dispute resolution service for electricity, gas and water complaints in NSW.

steps: Contact your energy/water provider first
Wait for their complaints process (up to 20 business days)
Contact EWON if unresolved
EWON will investigate and mediate
Binding decision may be issued
process.timeframe: Most complaints resolved within 20 business days
requirements: Must be a NSW residential or small business customer
Must have attempted resolution with provider first

agencies.name: Essential Services Commission Victoria
agencies.description: Independent regulator of essential services in Victoria including energy, water, and transport.

steps: Submit enquiry or complaint online
ESC will assess if it's within their jurisdiction
Investigation conducted if regulatory issue identified
Enforcement action taken if needed
requirements: Issue must relate to ESC's regulatory responsibilities
